intro: Pterygiella parishii, commonly known as the Parry's pterygiella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand hot, dry conditions. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it blooms during the cooler months of the year. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pterygiella parishii is considered a conservation concern.
